Tracer was in hot pursuit of Widowmaker, as she usually was, atop the rooftops of London. As she was about to corner her adversary, the Brit warped ahead just to close the gap even more. However as she jumped, instead of simply moving forward at the assassin, she vanished in a big flash of light, disappearing completely. Widowmaker, somewhat in shock, was quick to retreat from the rooftops, on edge for the rest of the night that Tracer would reappear and take her out.

But Tracer didn't return, mainly because she wasn't even in the same universe as Widowmaker was. When she jumped, she was looking at her rival up against a wall, but when she warped and the flash of light faded, she didn't see a brick wall, but instead what looked like a model skyscraper. Tracer crashed into it, knocking it over as she fell stomach-first onto the ground.
"Bloody hell... Where am I?" She asked, looking around, hearing faint screams in the distance.
"Is this... a scale model of New York City?" The speedster looked at the building she destroyed, identifying it as the Empire State Building. She smirked, bending over to look at it. "So realistic!" Tracer giggled, lifting the building up and noticing red stains under it. "They even got... fake... blood splatter..." Her smile faded as she realized it wasn't fake blood, it was very, very real.

Tracer had somehow warped out of her own world and into ours, and in ours she was absolutely massive. Big enough to easily take down a skyscraper.
"Where am I?!" She yelled out, looking over in the distance and seeing a huge collection of fighter jets coming at her. "Hey! Guys! Could you lot tell me where I am?" They didn't answer her, instead they began attempting to take her down, but none of their arsenal seemed to even make her flinch. Tracer couldn't help but laugh.
"Are you guys being serious? This is too funny. Lil' bullets can't harm me! I'm much bigger than you lot." She commented, holding one of the fighter jets that was around the size of her fingernail. "But I really do appreciate the effort." Tracer flicked the jet away, probably killing the person inside.

121.content:
"Get yourself together," he thought, "This is just another step toward Talon's dominance." Gabriel Reyes sat at the controls of a stealth airship above the Greek islands. The last 30 years of his life saw him turned into a super soldier, lead a team against the Omnic Crisis, and eventually go against it and found a terrorist organisation. Also, he became a half-ghost. He'd been on many heists and missions before, most of which were failures, but this time it was different.

An object had recently been unearthed outside the small town of Ilios, in Greece. Greek myths told of a woman who was given a powerful relic by the gods, and she used it to reach a titanic size, annihilating armies that invaded Greece. Soon the gods began to fear her, and as such removed this relic and buried it farther than any man could ever dig. As time went on, men made drills, and eventually the relic was discovered. News leaked, and eventually Ilios’s government decided to lock it away.

Gabe looked behind him at the two women in his airship. One woman was the elite and brainwashed sniper, Amélie Lacroix, who had been turned into Widowmaker. The other was a Mexican woman whose name Gabe didn’t know, but who went by Sombra. He thought about which of the two should be the one to use the relic, as it didn’t seem to affect men. On one hand, Widow was (literally) a cold-blooded killing machine. She would have absolutely no mercy in that position. On the other hand, Sombra was better on the ground than Widow. She seemed to just be able to manipulate anything in her favor. That said, Gabe held a sneaking suspicion that she was going to go rogue on Talon. She had tendency to go silent during important mission, like that time she was supposed to kill the head of Volskya Industries but she escaped.

No, it would be far better to use on Widow. She was a manipulated and controllable agent. Gabe landed the airship slightly outside the base where the relic was held.
121.title: The Ilios Heist

After sniping, hacking, and just blasting the guards in the face, Widow, Reaper, and Sombra seized the relic from the base. It turned out to be a small, golden ring which would easily fit either of the two female agents. Once back on board the airship, Gabe instructed Widow to see if the ring worked. “Let me try. Adding a few inches wouldn’t help her, she just stands still. I could use the extra inches to help me run faster while I’m cloaked,” said Sombra. Widow interrupted with her French accent, “Excuse me, but I do not think he told you to test it. Go sit down while I try it on.”

Sombra walked back to her seat in the back, with an expression of jealousy in her eyes. The sniper placed the ring on her right ring finger and nothing happened. “What am I supposed to do?” she asked Gabe. “I think you have to specify a size to be, and then it changes you,” he replied. Suddenly, Widow’s head raised up 3 inches, along with the rest of her. In her heels, she was at a height of 6’3, now letting her definitively look down on Sombra (they had been of about equal height before) and she could now look slightly down at Gabe. “Mon Dieu,” the taller woman uttered. She increased her height again, this time by 6 inches. She removed her heels, which has become tight, and sill stood in incredible 6’6.

“Well, it works. Take it off and we’ll head back to base and figure out what we can use it for,” said Gabe.

1232321.content:
Widowmaker sighed in frustration.

It wasn't all that often that her job demanded socializing off her. Most of the time, she would find a target, climb the nearest building, and BLAM, she was done. Usually. But not this time.
The scientist had proven elusive, even to her. Not one of her sources was capable of tracking the woman down. Hell, she didn't even know her name! The scientist seemed to have no public persona at all, in fact, only going by "Traveller" in certain select circles. Rumor had it, she was working on some kind of mass teleportation device, similar to what that british brat had strapped to her chest.
Just thinking of Tracer made Widowmaker grit her teeth. But she couldn't get angry now, not when she was so close!

A couple of days ago, Traveller had announced a surprise gathering, inviting many of the worlds top scientists to a penthouse in London, not all that far from the famous King's Row. It was the first time she had blown her cover - and Widowmaker had immediatly begun to spin her deadly web.

A few bribes and broken bones later and she was on the guest list. To her frustration, Traveller had yet to show herself and so she was forced to stay undercover by socializing with the gathered crowd. Many of them were perfectly fine with flinging complicated (and almost certainly, made up) terminology around in a vain effort to impress her. Widowmaker had retreated from any form of social engagement as soon as the bar opened.

The dress code was casual, more akin to a business meeting than a scientific conference. Widowmaker had scrunged together an outfit that made her look as if she had gotten lost on the way to a club. But it did the trick.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/bd/0d/5a/...

She was sipping a cold brandy when suddenly, the stage lights flared up. A hushed quiet descended on the room as the gathered guests observed the stage.
A small, older looking woman rolled a massive wagon onto the stage. On it was a huge, whirring metal cube. In the middle was a bright blue core, emanating a faint fluorescence that seemed very familiar to Widowmaker. She clutched the small gun she had hidden in her jacket. Any moment now...

"Apologies, ladies and gentlemen, for making you wait. I'm sure you are all just as excited as I am for this event. This evening, I will present to you the newest technology in the sector of teleportation, mass manipulation and, perhaps most ambitious of all... {dimensional travel/b}!"

A gasp went through the audience. Widowmaker ignored it. She had found her target, that was all that mattered. Slowly, she pushed herself through the crowd, ever closer to Traveller.

"I'm sure everybody here is familiar with the theory of infinite worlds. The thesis, that an infinite number of universes exist, similiar to our own, but more different, the higher the 'distance' between our worlds. This device is capable of proving that theory. You can imagine the possibilities of such a technology, ladies and gentlemen."

Now, Widowmaker was only a few feet away from her target. The excited crowd around her made her job difficult, though. Everybody was eager to catch a glimpse of the strange device and the crowd was pushing against each other. Widowmaker gritted her teeth. It was now or never.

With trained athleticism, she jumped out of the crowd and onto the stage, pulling out her gun in one swift motion. The audience gasped again - but with fear, this time.
Her eyes trained on her target, she aimed her gun... only to be interrupted by the noise of hurried footsteps. In the corner of her eye, she saw two large men in black suits rushing towards her. Bodyguards! How had she not seen them? Had she been so sloppy?

Surprised by the sudden appearance, Widowmaker jumped again. Just as the two thugs reached her, she kicked out her legs, instantly knocking both of them out. But her move wasn't as clean as it should have been. She was already firing her weapon the moment she jumped - but now the trajectory had changed. The bullet, meant for the scientist, whizzed instead right into the blue core of the dimensional travel device.

A loud buzz rang through the room. Widowmaker landed and trained her gun once more on the old woman. Only barely she noticed the look on Traveller's face. Abject horror at the destruction of her work. But there was something more... a fear of what would happen.
Widowmaker's finger curled around the trigger. But just before she could finish her job, the low buzz suddenly became a violent explosion of noise. Panicked, she looked at the device, just in time to see the core explode. A blue wave of light, flickering like fire, flew directly at her. She could feel herself being lifted of the ground as if something huge had just flung her away. All air was pressed out of her lungs, her gun falling somewhere into the crowd. The world became a blur.
And Widowmaker lost consciousness.



But when she woke up, she didn't feel all that bad. In fact, she couldn't feel any of the bruises she must have suffered from the explosion. More importantly, there were no handcuffs on her.
She got up, looking around. Her mind went blank. She was in a completely different location! The grey walls and steel towers of london had been replaced by a sunny sky and an open field. How was this possible? Had she been teleported by the explosion.

Then she looked down - and everything changed. She wasn't in an open field at all, that had just been the horizon. In fact, she was in a small village. And there was a good reason, why she hadn't noticed it at first.

Widowmaker was HUGE! She was still half-sitting, leaning on her elbows while surveying her surroundings. Her enormous butt was planted firmly in the center of the small village. She could see debris of pulverized houses peeking out beneath her colossal rear. Her feet had crushed the road leading into the village. She had stepped right into traffic. Numerous cars had piled up against the side of her boot.

For a moment, all Widowmaker could do was simply stare. Staring at the crushed buildings, the demolished cars. Staring at the tiny people scurrying out of their homes, away from the gargantuan assassin. Staring at her surroundings: a destroyed village, surrounded by fields and forests. And on the horizon - skyscrapers of a large metropolis piercing the clouds.

Slowly, Widowmaker got up, brushing the dust and debris off her pants. She couldn't believe it. This place didn't seem like her world - there was far to little tech for that. Hell, she could see the exhaust of the primitive cars. Apparently the inhabitants of this world hadn't yet abandoned gasoline.
And furthermore, she had been changed into a giantess. Killing had always been her craft, but now? There was nothing she couldn't do. No one, who could stop her. She was like a goddess...

A grin formed on Widowmaker's face. A goddess, yes... that sounded good. She was tired of being beholden to someone. Now, she was the only one in charge. And she wanted to savour that experience...

13222122.title: Does D.Va notice?

134.content:
D.Va sat in her firm yet ergonomic chair, leaning forward so that she could stare more intently at her monitor with her wide brown eyes. Blue spotlights shined on her wearing her signature skin-tight suit, beads of sweat forming under her black bangs. She honestly didn't even know why she had to play in the qualifying round: everyone else here was some lame nobody, at least compared to her, as evidenced by the banners of her leaning against her MEKA on either side of the stage, and the camera, broadcast to a fifty-foot high television screen, zoomed in on her face.

In the opening minutes of the free-for-all it became apparent she had nothing to worry about, and the light perspiration was mostly caused by the lights. So far no one had been able to land a single shot on her as she weaved effortlessly between their digital bullets, merely delaying her in killing them once again. One in particular seemed particularly bad, and ran at her in straight lines over and over again. Each time he respawned his movements got even more predictable, and before long she took pleasure in hunting him down, taking an easy kill to run up her score.

"stop no fair" popped up in the chat window after the twentieth or so time he added to D.Va's kill count. She laughed, and the crowd erupted into cheers. Her smile lasted until the next time she found him, this time running straight into a wall outside his spawn. Swiftly she offed him again, then typed out "lol ;)" before heading off to find another victim.

She found him several more times before the match ended, standing stock still and providing no challenge. D.Va gladly took the free point before adding a half dozen more to her score from other players, each of them starting to play worse by the end of the twenty minutes. Finally the match ended, and the other players sighed in relief. Quickly she typed out "GG nubs :)" before standing when the lights came up.

When she was fully standing, something seemed off to the petite Korean, but she couldn't put her finger on it. She vaguely remembered where her target had been sitting, and wanted to go rub his miserable defeat in his face. D.Va took a step to the left, expecting to have to squeeze past the huge German who had been next to her, but saw no sign of him. With another resolute step her foot bumped into something, followed by a soft thud. Annoyed she looked down, expecting to see that she had accidentally knocked over his inferior rig, but instead saw something much more interesting.

The man, who had previously been over a head taller than D.Va, was sprawled out on the floor, no taller than her knees! She looked around and noticed that the most she could see of anyone over their monitors was the tops of their head, and in many cases not even that much. Her neighbor yelled for her to stop, and she only offered "QQ more" before stepping over him and heading to her primary target.

Each gamer she passed was in a different pathetic state compared to her, most coming up to about her waist or mid-thigh. One, quite a few seats from where her quarry was, had to dodge the MEKA pilot's metal-encased foot as it slammed down, though she didn't even notice him at only a few inches. Another, about a foot tall, cowered under his desk as D.Va passed. She stopped to lean over, looking under the desk at him shaking. "Boo!" she shouted, making him jump, before standing up again to continue along her way.

Finally she reached her main target's chair, only to find it empty. There was no sign of its owner anywhere. "Where'd you go, noob? Did I own you so hard you shrank into nothing?" D.Va asked, smart enough to figure out what had happened. She leaned onto the desk, peering behind the keyboard and monitor but finding no sign of him. Already bored, she flicked the mouse with a gloved finger, but didn't find him hiding behind or under it.

For a moment she glanced at the screen, and saw that the timer until the next match, superimposed over the live broadcast of her face, was about to reach zero. D.Va leaned back over, inspecting the missing gamer's equipment. It wasn't nearly as good as hers, and she considered humiliating them even more by playing with this machine.

From the seat of the chair the unnoticed gamer watched D.Va, the absolutely titanic Korean making him realize just how insignificant he had become. At one quarter of an inch he had fallen into one of the seams of his chair and was having trouble getting back out. He watched her butt sway back and forth, cradled within her pink, skin-tight bodysuit while she looked over his station. With apprehension he saw the timer reach zero with her still at his seat, unknowingly casting him in the shadow of her spotlight.
134.title: Tournament Night

choices: She leaves him alone for now
1342.content:
The miniscule gamer watched with horror when D.Va rested her gloved hands on the arm rests and began sitting. "D.Va, no, stop!" he shouted while her butt descended toward him, but he was much too small for her to hear over the noise of everyone else scrambling back to their positions. When her butt set down he' got pressed under it, and once her weight was fully on the chair he was crushed, not even leaving a noticeable stain on her suit.

Completely unaware of the man she just sat on D.Va rolled the chair closer to the table and got ready for the next round. On first inspection she hadn't noticed the Cheeto dust on the mouse or fragments of Doritos in between some of the keys, which might explain his poor performance. Despite this handicap she was confident she would be able to continue dominating these nerds, especially with their new handicaps.

When the match started again D.Va noticed several avatars not moving at all, their players too small to reach the keyboards by now. She made sure to leave them for later when there was no one else to kill, since they had already been shrunken enough. Very few other players could do more than move in one direction anyway, and they were taken out as often as possible; at the end of this match. D.Va hoped to see nobody taller than her knees.

This round went very similar to the previous one, but no one complained this time. Some of them she knew wouldn't even be able to type anything since they would have to jump on the keys. When it ended and she had exactly zero deaths again she triumphantly typed out "GG ;) not really" then stood to survey how the field looked now.

There were no signs of anyone else until D.Va looked down at the floor. She had so thoroughly beaten them this time that the tallest of her competitors only came up to her ankle. To survey the damage she walked back around the circle of computers to where she had been sitting previously, seeing how much smaller they had become.

She reached the one who cowered from her earlier, eager to see where he was now. He was out in the open this time, probably trying to hide again but his legs couldn't get him there fast enough. There was no way he was taller than an inch, but he easily stood out against the blue lighting on the floor. Quickly she moved to stand astride him and looked down at him. "Wow, you must suck!" D.Va teases. "I've been crushing you in game, now I could crush you for real!"

The gamer had been trying to get away when the deafening thuds of D.Va's footfalls approached, and when they neared he knew he'd have no chance of escaping. Two enormous metal-soled white shoes slammed down on either side of him, and he looked the MEKA pilot up and down - mostly up. The "little" Korean must have been hundreds of feet tall, and her shoes alone would have have been a complex climb for him. He weathered her booming voice, then froze when she lifted one of her shoes and positioned it right over him.

"Maybe I should!" D.Va added, centering her shoe over the poor, tiny gamer. No one made any moves to stop her, and he wasn't even trying to run away. She winks down at the man, seriously considering the option.
1342.title: Up Close and Personal with D.Va

13421.content:
D.Va spent a moment thinking about it, and simply could not come up with a reason she shouldn't smash this person. She brought her foot down as hard as she could on top of him, crushing him instantly with her metallic sole and generating so much force her loose hair bounced from the impact. The instant her foot touched down the crowd erupted into cheers, and she took a second to draw a heart in the air for them, making them cheer even harder.

For the rest of the walk back all the other competitors ran and hid from her, not wanting to meet the same unfortunate fate. Even her neighbor, who had towered over her less than an hour before, ducked behind the wheel of his chair to watch the monolithic D.Va walk past. She considered stepping on all of them as she went by, but thought better of it. If they were all plastered on the bottom of her shoe, who would she play against?

When she reached her station again, she saw a dozen tiny computers set up in a semicircle between her keyboard and the edge. She sat down and several attendants came out from behind the curtains, then went about brushing up the remains of her competition into dust pans. When all but two were accounted for they brought them to where D.Va sat and dumped them out onto the desk, spilling them into a very disoriented pile.

D.Va leaned over the crowd of shrunken gamers, her purple top filling the sky for them. She paid them no mind as she readied up, her wrist nearly smashing two of them who had strayed from the bundle. They scrambled to get a seat under the woman looming over them, and when they all sat down the announcer came over the loudspeaker.

"It's time for sudden death!" he said. "Now as D.Va eliminates a player, she can eliminate that player in any way she chooses!" D.Va looked down at the group gathered before her, no doubt scared out of their wits, and waved.
13421.title: Hana's Heel

134211.content:
The round started for D.Va quite differently than the other two had. Instead of everyone rushing to try to take her down a notch the other players fled from her, hoping that they would be allowed to survive this round. D.Va, however, was not willing to oblige; they had gotten themselves into this mess with their sub-par skills, so they should be able to deal with the consequences. She idly blew a bubble and gunned down her first target, and a tiny spotlight lit up when he died, pointing out which unfortunate gamer died first.

From the desk the shrunken gamers had difficulty focusing on what they were doing. Not only were they fearful of their impending dooms, they kept stealing glances at the beautiful gamer above them, apparently paying them no mind. The thunderous boom every time she depressed a key and clicked the mouse certainly didn't help, and the giant pink cloud ballooning from her mouth drew all of their gazes. That is, until one of them got the spotlight put on him.

D.Va looked down at the unlucky man who, for what it mattered, was doing his best to escape. She, of course, had no intention of letting that happen, and lifted her hand from the mouse, moving it above him. Briefly she tracked his movements while he futilely ran, then extended her index finger. With honed accuracy she brought a white-gloved finger down on top of him, pinning him to the polished surface, and with a slight push smashed him flat under it.

Having squished the first loser D.Va got back into the game and started looking for her next target. Even though she was taking it easy on them now it didn't take long, causing the tiny gamer in her sights to let out a high-pitched squeak. He clumsily shot back at her a couple times, clearly distracted by not only his impending doom but also the fantastic giantess all around him, and in seconds he was in the spotlight too.

This one didn't even bother running, since he knew that there's no way he could outrun her reach. He swiftly found himself trapped between D.Va's thumb and forefinger and lifted out of his chair, his legs flailing wildly in the air. D.Va lifted him to her eyes and peered at him in her gloved grip, trying to make out the expression on his face. Not finding anything besides fear she squeezes her fingers together, squishing him in her hand, then returned to the game.

It wasn't long before she found her third target, hiding halfway inside a terrain glitch that D.Va knew all too well. Out of principle she raced toward him and burst through the bugged terrain, shocking the player who had been hoping to avoid her notice. D.Va heard a high-pitched yelp from him and watched his avatar frantically evade, but his panicked movements were no matched for her practiced skill, and very soon he, too, was in the spotlight.

D.Va was already reaching for him before he was even eliminated, and was able to snatch him up before his brain registered what had happened. Her fingertips met on the collar of his shirt, pulling him out of his chair and up towards her. She could hear him screaming in his high-pitched voice and watched his legs kick, but that didn't dissuade her at all. Soon the gamer was being held above D.Va's head, which she tilted back slightly and centered her prey over her open mouth. D.Va let go, dropping him in so that he landed against her gullet, and promptly swallowed him to raucous applause from the audience.

Before she could find another target, the match ended, leaving her with a kill count of three - still, three more than anyone else got. Leaving her hands where they were she leaned her face in toward the remaining gamers, bringing it within inches of them. She let out a giggle and said, "GG!" no doubt temporarily deafening them with her excited bellow.

To her surprise though all of the survivors, instead of clutching their ears, began to rapidly dwindle in front of her eyes. "That's the last round," the announcer declared, "and now it's up to our star D.Va to decide what the losers get!" Her eyes widened with surprise, then playfully narrowed again while she considered how to take them all out.
134211.title: Deathmatch

1342112.content:
While she looked them over the tiny gamers stood in rapt attention, unable to tear their eyes away from her face looming over them. D.Va's eyes darted from each of them, trying to figure out the most entertaining fashion to kill all of the survivors. When her mind settled on an idea she got a mischievous grin and stood, the upper half of her body casting the shrunken gamers into her shadow. "Time for you to meet the best part of my suit!" she said, and turned around.

When she was fully facing the audience D.Va took her time, waving at the crowd and blowing kisses at no one in particular. She posed for the camera, letting her radiant visage be broadcast throughout the hall and doing her best to have fun with it - after all, she knew that those losers weren't going anywhere. Finally, unable to stall any longer, she made her move.

First D.Va set her hands on the table behind her, trapping the group between them, then she bent forward to accentuate her butt as the suit tightened around it. When she felt ready she yelled "Nerf this!" and pushed herself off the floor, sending her ass on a direct course for the people corralled between her hands.

The group knew what was coming as soon as she turned around, but she was right: there wasn't anything they could do about it, and it would be impossible for them to get away. They watched helplessly while she worked the crowd, then realized the end would soon be upon them when her enormous gloves set down on each side with a soft thud.

When D.Va bent down they knew they had only a few seconds left, and resolved to at least enjoy their view of her immaculate ass before it smashed them. They watched it arc through the air and head towards them, getting even more massive in their view as it dropped. Finally D.Va's titanic ass landed on the desk, smashing each person simultaneously between her butt cradled by the form-fitting plugsuit and the table.

When they were all dead D.Va lingered on the table, swinging her legs back and forth casually. She looked at the camera and blew a quick bubble, and seemed to almost be bored with the whole situation already. With one hand she brushed her long hair back and turned to face one of the cameras, waiting for it to zoom in on her before smiling and drawing a heart. But now that she's crushed the competition, what else is there for her to do?

1342113.content:
The look on D.Va's face turned mischievous when she came up with her fool-proof and novel idea to drive her victory home. By now all the tiny computers had receded, leaving only the shrunken people to stare up at her, wondering what she was going to do. The idea of letting them go never so much as entered her mind, and her pink, painted whiskers twitched with her nose in excitement.

"This one's for my fans!" she declared, and started blowing another bubble with her gum. All the gamers beneath her quickly turned from marveling at her to running in terror, their legs futilely trying to escape from the expanding balloon. D.Va watched them flee, little more than specks to her dark eyes, and continued pushing air into the bubble. One by one they were all caught, trapped in the gum when it engulfed their back.

After they were all caught D.Va kept blowing the bubble until it burst, making a soft popping sound to her that, if they could still hear, would have definitely deafened the speck-sized men caught in it. D.Va slowly sucked the gum back into her mouth, dragging each of the losers along with it, until all of it was back inside her lips. For a moment she remained still, feeling the gamers struggling to get free against her tongue.

D.Va pressed the gum against the roof of her mouth, pushing each of the trapped people further into the sticky substance. She then quickly maneuvered it back to her lips and blew another bubble, large enough for her to look at. The camera zoomed in on it, showing the nine specks inside or outside the sphere, with D.Va's face dominating the shot on either side. Again it popped, causing it to go limp, and she quickly drew it back inside her mouth.

Once it was past her lips D.Va knocked it to the side with her tongue, centering it on top of her molars. She gave a quick wink to the camera and flashed the peace sign before closing her jaw to begin chewing again and biting down on all nine of the trapped losers, chewing them thoroughly. The crowd went wild.

Confident in her victory D.Va stood and turned to the adoring crowd. She took a bow, and listened while the emcee announced the next event.

15131.content:
Mercy was wandering around the Overwatch HQ, her weapons and gear on her just in case she was needed to support a team on a moment's notice. After all, it wasn't uncommon that she had more missions than planned, since every good team needed someone to keep them in fighting shape. But since today seemed a little quieter than usual, she'd decided to go and see what Winston was working on.

Poking her head into his lab, she was surprised to see no sign of him. Her curiosity getting the better of her, she headed into the room, maybe she'd be able to figure out anything in there on her own. On a table, she spotted a few things worth having a look at. There was one of what looked like one of Winston's shield projectors, a pile of components for a weapon of sorts and a barebones looking prototype of what looked like chrono-accelerator, like the one he gave Tracer to keep her existent.

Smiling slightly, she picked up the accelerator. Mercy had wanted to figure out how this kind of thing worked, since blinking about would be an excellent boon on the battlefield. She could only imagine how much more she could help with a power like that.

Then, quite suddenly, she heard a shattering noise from outside. The shock of it had caused her to drop the accelerator, it components sparking as it hit the ground. Mercy gasped, backing up. The instrument appeared to be breaking, the inner core fluctuating rapidly. Biting her lip, the medic went to pick it up, she felt awfully guilty for breaking one of his gadgets. But then, as she grabbed the machine, she felt a tingling sensation all over, and the next thing she knew, she was in a completely new place, no sign of the accelerator or the HQ. To her utter surprise, it appeared to be a model of:
15131.title: Giantess (Real world)

choices: Get rid of any evidence that the 'model' existed.
151311.content:
Mercy blinked a few times in surprise, the model she stood before reached up to her chin, it was completely dominated by the mysteriously appearing medic, her mechanical wings spread out as she entered the new landscape, yellow light radiating from them. She glanced around, amazed by the level of detail in the model skyscrapers. Looking around once more, she was surprised to see no sign of anybody, which lead to the assumption that this model had been abandoned. Which was a shame, so much effort had been put into it.

"I guess nobody would mind if I move one of these, it's awfully cramped here," She shrugged, turning to push the model behind her. But as she did this, her wings smashed through the stone of the buildings, tiny people and tiny objects being swished out. Mercy gasped, turning her staff around in her hands as she broke two of the skyscrapers. Numerous falling people had clung onto her waist, to avoid hitting the floor, though some had done just that, being instantly killed.

Mercy cupped a hand over her mouth, "Oh my," She gasped, not meaning to break the model. If the people who made this found out, then they wouldn't be too happy with her. If the people affected by her clumsiness were just a little bit bigger, she'd be able to heal or resurrect them with her abilities, but they were even too small for her equipment to detect.

She sighed, her clumsiness had gotten her into a real mess, no idea where her home and friends were, and she was here, ruining a model city. She began to wonder, how could she get out of this problem.
151311.title: New York

choices: Yes, and she gets him a friend
15132.content:
Mercy stood in front of her clinic, healing gun gripped tightly in her hands. Not only had this thing revolutionized medicine when it was developed, but it made treatment of nearly everything a cinch. It was barely even worthwhile to do a full examination anymore when she could simply zap them with her gun for a few seconds and cure them of anything that might have ailed them, whether there was anything wrong or not. She had taken to standing outside and letting people form a line, charging them exorbitant prices remotely once she was done.

After about an hour she fell into a routine, barely even noticing who she was healing or why. It was all the same, and so few of them thanked her that she saw them more as faceless drones begging for her services. At least she could charge them even if they wouldn't give her the only thanks she really wanted.

Another man reached the front of the line, and without even thinking Mercy pulled the trigger to zap him. A loud pop came from the gun and electricity jumped at her glove, and a red beam coursed into him. He screamed in pain when it hit him, and Mercy quickly took her finger off the trigger. "What the hell, lady?" he protested. "That hurt!"

"Oh, I am zo zohry!" Mercy apologized, giving a slight bow. "I am having, eh... malvunction. Please, let me make it up to you, free of charge."

"All right, but no tricks this time!" he replied.

Mercy looked down and gave a reassuring smile. "Don't worry, zis won't hurt a bit!" she said, and gave him a boost. This time an orange beam came out of the gun, hitting the man in the chest. Her jaw dropped in surprise when he rapidly dwindled, too shocked to even take her finger off the trigger. By the time she thought to stop pumping the beam into him he was no larger than a bug.

Indistinct squeaking came from the tiny man while the line behind him cleared out. Mercy looked down at him, horrified. "Please believe me, I am zo, zo zohry!" she said. "I did not mean to..." One of the fleeing people bumped into her, shoving her forward. There was a soft crunch, and when she looked down her boot was exactly where the shrunken man had been standing. She winced and pulled her foot back, revealing his squashed remains on the pavement.

Someone tapped Mercy on the shoulder and she flinched, spinning around. To her surprise there was a young man standing there looking up at her. He was about a head shorter than her, and looked very eager. "Okay, now do me," he said.

"Come again?" Mercy asked.

"Make me small, like you did him!" he insisted.

"I don't underztand," Mercy said. "You want me to... zhrink you?"

"Yeah!" he said, a little too enthusiastically. "Doctor Ziegler, I would be honored if you shrank me."

Mercy looked very uncomfortable, but who was she to deny someone what she wanted? Besides, her day had just been cleared, and she could use a way to pass the time. Should she do it?
15132.title: Power to shrink others (Real world)

choices: Take him back to her office
Try to find out where he lives
151321.content:
Mercy looked down at him again, furrowing her brow. Her finger rested on the trigger for the boost, but she hesitated. "Are you abzolutely zhure?" she asked, her voice shaking a little. "If I do zis, I don't sink zere's a way to make you big again."

"That's perfect!" he replied. "I want to be tiny with you! C'mon, just make me small!" His insistence was beginning to weird Mercy out, and she was getting to the point where she wanted to shrink him just so he would shut up.

"Okay," she assented, raising the healing gun toward him. "If it's what you really want." He nodded, and Mercy squeezed her eyes shut, unable to watch someone else dwindle to bug size. She pulled the trigger, releasing what would normally be a boost into him, and held it down for several seconds. When she opened her eyes again he was gone.

Mercy had to force herself to look down and see the puny man in front of her. His cheering did nothing to assuage her guilt, nor did his repeatedly stated desires to have this done to him. "Zere, you're zmall," she said, followed by a loud sigh. "I hope you're happy." Even though he was tiny, she could see him dancing at her feet.

She wanted to walk away and leave him there. Her job was done, after all: she had made him tiny, just as she had asked. Before she could step away, though, her conscience got the better of her. If he were left alone in this state he would easily fall prey to just about anything, and that would be on her. Even if she didn't want it, he was her responsibility now.

After another heavy sigh she squatted and looked down at him, resting her wrists on her knees. He was still cheering, but his tiny voice was difficult to hear. Mercy reached down and plucked him off the ground, careful not to squeeze too tightly. "Is it everysing you hoped?" she asked, at a loss for any other words.

"You're huge, Doctor Ziegler!" he shouted. "I love it!" Mercy pinched the bridge of her nose while she gathered her thoughts. What would she even do with him?

151322.content:
Something about the way he asked - nay, insisted - that she be the one to shrink him rubbed Mercy the wrong way. It was weird that he wanted to be shrunk in the first place, but that last line made up her mind. If he wanted to be tiny she would make his dream come true, and do her best to turn it into his nightmare.

Mercy raised the healing gun and pointed it at him, her finger resolutely on the trigger. He was looking at her with wide eyes, just waiting for her to do it. She checked to make sure that the beam was set to boost, which would hopefully have the opposite effect still. If she only made him stronger for a short time she might end up even more disappointed than him.

With a grin Mercy pulled the trigger, firing the orange beam into the overeager man. He rapidly diminished in size, looking up at her in ecstasy the whole time. She considered keeping it down, seeing just how small she could make him with this, but let go after only a couple seconds. The tiny man did not even come up past the toe of her boots, and if she didn't know better she would have easily mistaken him for a bug.

Mercy stepped forward until she stood astride the shrunken person, making sure he was centered between her feet. She placed her hands on her hips and looked down at him, unable to suppress her grin. "Zere, you are zmall," she declared, and he responded by cheering up at her. The rest of her statement was bound to change his mind. "However, zince you are zo zmall, you cannot pay. Zat means you are now mine, and I can do vatever I vant vif you." The cheering stopped and he looked up at Mercy in horror. At last she could no longer hide it and began laughing, her low chuckle no doubt filling him with dread. "You zhould haf fought zis out better before I made you zo puny."

The reality of his situation finally hit him, and the miniscule man began to run. Mercy laughed harder at his sudden change of heart and followed him with her big blue eyes. He was hers, now, and she would not let him get away so easily.

15332.content:
Friday night. It was as uninteresting as any other. You worked at a company that manufactured many kinds of machines. But ever since management relocated you to overlook their Russian facilities, you felt that your job had become nothing more than a glorified watchman. Only even duller since nothing ever happens. At least, that was until tonight.

You were making rounds through the facility making sure everything was running smoothly when suddenly you heard a feint, unfamiliar buzzing sound. At first you ignored it, but after another minute the buzzing was replaced by an explosion. "Oh God!" You repeated to yourself as you ran towards the source of the sounds and tremors only to immediately bump into something invisible and fall over. Soon the invisible figures cloaking failed revealing a Hispanic looking girl with a weird glowing suit on. She looked annoyed with you, but mostly panicked about something behind her. Looking back you saw her. A living legend and hero of the country. Zarya. Even in your brief time here, you heard plenty of her exploits. Her actions are considered the stuff of legend, and here she was right in front of you, chasing the girl you accidently stopped. However, you saw the girl reaching for something good behind her back. The design wasn't familiar, but you feared that it had to be dangerous. Was she going to kill Zarya with it. What could you do? As Zarya drew nearer, the girl adjusted her grip clearly intending to throw it. You couldn't stay on the ground, you had to do something. And in a burst of pure adrenaline, you dove for the device, pulling it from her grip. You startled the attacker causing her to push it into your palm from the jump. As the device started to glow, your vision went dark. You expected the end.

Several minutes later, your eyes reopened. You weren't dead miraculously, but your body was extremely sore. You heard a loud, feminine voice saying something in Russian above you causing you to look up to a sight that you were. It prepared for. Hovering above you was Zarya's face. Except she was HUGE. Not huge like how she normally was but absolutely gigantic. You were literally in the palm of her hand.
"Or would English be better?" Her voice boomed once more. You hesitated for about 15 seconds trying to take this all in before nodding timidly at the muscular goddess. She smiled a little "You did good back there. I'll make sure you're safe with me at that size." Well that was rather reassuring, though she was still a very intimidating sight to behold.
15332.title: Protector of Man, big or small.

153322.content:
"This place should be clear for the night. I'd better get you home immediately." Her husky voice boomed down on you, dispite her attempts to speak softly to you. She smirked slightly as you flinched anyway apparently finding you cute in your current state.
"I don't live with anyone, it would probably be better if you took me to the authorities or a hospital or something." You meekly suggested trying your best to sound confidant to this titaness. Zarya simply shook her head.
"Not your home silly. Mine. You were hit by a top secret expiramental weapon. The doctors wouldn't know what to do and the authorities wouldn't let you leave their research site since you'd know too much and would be the perfect specimen for human tests."
The color fled from your face as she said this.
"They could easily cover it up thanks to the terrorist attack. You'd be presumed dead and remain in a test facility for life." Her finger started to stroke your back as she felt you shudder. She knew this was a lot for you to take in. Though she tried to be gentle, the tree trunk sized digit was still a bit rough on your delicate form.
"That's why I'll keep you. I'll use the same story for you. Let you stay with me. Much preferable to being a lab rat."

You remained quiet. You weren't sure how much of this story was true, but it definitely sounded likely. After all, given her position, Zarya probably had a better understand of their reaction to your predicament than you would. And if you were stuck like this, who better to stick around with than the worlds strongest woman? Still this whole predicament was strange and overwealming. As you stood in her palm silently, Zarya looked down at you as if she was waiting for something. She probably spoke while you were zoned out here.
"Sorry." You responded trying to adopt your confident facade once more. "I missed that last bit."
She nodded and repeated herself. "Even I will have to clear a security checkpoint when I leave here. It won't be as intense as it would be for others, but I may have to hide you in more... unconventional places." You didn't like the sound of that.
"It will only be for a few minutes. Just need to make sure you get out safe. Are you fine with that?" You sighed and nodded taking a leap of faith and placing your trust in the Russian giant.
"Very well." Zarya then proceeded to place you on the ground and tinker with her armored clothing, making an opening to store you...

1533221.content:
You stayed out as you stared up at Zarya who was adjusting something on her boot before she started tugging on it trying to pull it off. You quickly picked up on where she planned to store you. Her loud grunting was enough to tell you that the boot was on tight. Finally with one really good pull, the boot finally came off revealing a tall, lanky, and bare foot that was trapped inside. The toes wiggled as they enjoyed some freedom and fresh air. You watched this in awe. Even the simplistic motion of wiggling her toe was a humbling sight for you. You stared at the sole, still a little red from moving about all day, realizing just how effortlessly even her toes could subdue you. The foot rested near you as Zarya looked for where she put the boot, tapping the ground and making tiny tremors. It had just sunk in just how helpless you truly were in this state.

Your thoughts were interrupted by feminine giggling from above.
"Like what you see?" You snap out of it and look from the foot up at Zarya who was smirking.
"N-no it wasn't that I was just-" you tried to explain, but Zarya gently placed a massive finger over your lips.
"It's fine, little one. I actually think it's pretty cute that you like my foot. And it will definitely make tho next part easier on us." She removed the finger and gently plucked you up and moved you over the boot.
"When we get back home, I'll let you play with the foot all you want." She says as she places you in the boot. It was hot and damp inside, unsurprisingly. Before you could do anything, Zarya was already sliding her foot back into the boot. You found yourself pinned under the arch of her foot, leaving you with little room to move. Zarya stands back up and proceeds to leave, taking care not to step too hard on you. Inside you could hardly tell as the foot would increase and decrease the pressure it put on you at rhythmic intervals.

It seemed like a miracle that you could even breathe in the tight, damp setting you were trapped in as your "rescuer" smuggled you out of the facility. It seemed like a while since the sole presses down on top of you. You figured she was sitting down. The impact of that last one had just sunk in. Shrinking tech is super classified stuff. Even if anyone could undo it, they likely won't. Your normal life had been irreparably destroyed once and for all. It was a dark though to take in, but it could have been much much worse. At least Zarya found you and offered to take you in. You were asleep in your room. Job hunt didn't go as well as you had hoped. Still you had enough money saved that you could last a bit longer before things got really bad.
